meanings.definition: The quality or state of being loose or relaxed.
meanings.sent1: The hammock's slackness made it perfect for a lazy afternoon nap.
meanings.sent2: She felt the slackness of the elastic waistband on her pajama pants.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics highlighted the slackness of its movements.
meanings.sent4: The slackness of the rope allowed the boat to drift aimlessly in the water.
meanings.sent5: The slackness of the rubber band made it easy to stretch and play with.

meanings.sent1: The slackness of the rubber band made it useless for holding things together.
meanings.sent2: The sail flapped in the wind due to the slackness of the ropes holding it.
meanings.sent3: The slackness of the balloon made it difficult to tie securely.
meanings.sent4: The slackness of the guitar strings resulted in a dull, muted sound.
meanings.sent5: The slackness of the fabric caused the dress to hang loosely on the hanger.

meanings.sent1: His work suffered due to the slackness in his attention to detail.
meanings.sent2: The teacher reprimanded the student for the slackness in completing assignments.
meanings.sent3: The slackness in following safety procedures led to an accident in the lab.
meanings.sent4: The slackness in handling customer complaints resulted in a loss of business.
meanings.sent5: The slackness in time management caused him to miss important deadlines.

meanings.definition: A period of time when work is not being done.
meanings.sent1: During the lunch break, there was a noticeable slackness in productivity.
meanings.sent2: The weekend brought a welcomed slackness after a busy week at the office.
meanings.sent3: The slackness in the schedule allowed for some much-needed relaxation time.
meanings.sent4: The slackness in the workload gave them a chance to catch up on personal tasks.
meanings.sent5: The slackness in the pace of the project indicated a delay in completion.
